solution_line_template: For the first {first_period_minutes} minutes, {num_intervals_first_period}*{flow_rate_cups_per_interval}=<<{num_intervals_first_period}*{flow_rate_cups_per_interval}={water_first_period}>>{water_first_period} cups of water came out.

For the next {next_period_minutes} minutes, {num_intervals_next_period}*{flow_rate_cups_per_interval}=<<{num_intervals_next_period}*{flow_rate_cups_per_interval}={water_next_period}>>{water_next_period} cups of water came out.

For the next hour, {num_intervals_max_flow}*{max_flow_rate_cups_per_interval}=<<{num_intervals_max_flow}*{max_flow_rate_cups_per_interval}={water_max_flow_period}>>{water_max_flow_period} cups of water came out.

A total of {water_first_period}+{water_next_period}+{water_max_flow_period}=<<{water_first_period}+{water_next_period}+{water_max_flow_period}={total_water_came_out}>>{total_water_came_out} cups of water came out.
Shawn had to dump water which left {total_water_came_out}/{dump_divisor}=<<{total_water_came_out}/{dump_divisor}={water_left}>>{water_left} cups of water.
